With an air of light heartedness Tucson smiles to Night Viper and then spo=
ts his sword, cross bow and quiver of plasma tipped arrows.  He points to t=
hem.

There , I will need those weapons, and that's it.  They were confisca=
cted from me when I was brought here.  "

He gives a careful listen to ever=
ything around him and then turns his attentions back to his comrades.

"  R=
emember, please leave Rodimus up to me, and be sure you escape safely.  He'=
s my responsibility, and I have to deal with him myself.  I trust he is wel=
l trained but perhaps not as in depth as I was.  He will cheat in ways you =
may find unfathomable.  I have prepared for the unexpected and know how to =
confront it.  Now, let's do this while we still can."

oups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

son looks to Night Viper with a somewhat commanding stare.  Of course it

e reference."

> NIGHT VIPER spins around to face TUSCON, he had not been=
 talking to
> him at the time but about him, but the point stood. "Yes sir,=
 your
> Primeship, of course." He saluted him with a smile. "It won't happe=
n
> again suh!" He said.

nnel that exited high up

hile not nearly as

but his bulk
> made little noise as it came down. More of a combat landing,=
 but it
> was solid enough.
> 
> Looking around he glanced at the scene, LO=
NG RACK and the rest loking
> at TUSCON PRIME and NIGHT VIPER, the latter s=
tanding at attention
> saluting the former. He shook his head, "You got the=
 stash ready?" He
> said looking over at LONGRACK.
> 
> The tall yet slimly=
 built second officer nodded, "Of course, right
> here boss." He said, hold=
ing out a rather large case to him. He nodded
> over at TUSCON, "What about=
 the Prime?"
> 
> "I'll handle it." CONVOY said as he turned to look at TUS=
CON.
> 
> Openeing the case there were two missile racks which he carefully=
 slid
> on each shoulder, increasing his bulk for a moment before they fold=
ed
> into his shoulders, and he picked up a rather large looking cannon and=

> hefted it experimantally. He nodded, satisfied.
> 
> "Tuscon Prime." BIG=
 CONVOY said, emphasising the 'Prime' part of
> TUSCON's name presumably fo=
r the benfit of the others, "You need any
> sort of weaponry or armaments b=
efore we move on?" He glanced up at the
> grating they had just come out of=
, he closed it with the tip of his
> cannon.
> 
> "I would suspect they wil=
l soon discover our ruse." He looked at

if you're ready? This is going to get
